metadata.title: CVE-2020-36558 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition in the Linux kernel before 5.5.7 involving VT_RESIZEXcould lead to a NULL pointer dereference and general protection fault.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-178-generic - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-178-generic - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-178-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1066-aws - 4.4.0-1066.70
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.70').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92~14.04.1').
